What Are TDAs?

Why TDAs are Needed
Why TDAs are Needed

TRANSPORTATION
TRANSPORTATION

LAND USE
LAND USE

Transportation investment and policies affect mobility, connectivity and access as well as land use patterns, community and economic development.
Transportation
investment and policies
affect mobility,
connectivity and access
as well as land use
patterns, community
and economic
development.

Transportation Development Agreements (TDAs)
Transportation
Development
Agreements
(TDAs)

The type, location and scale of existing and future land use has a strong influence on the overall transportation system.
The type, location and
scale of existing and
future land use has a
strong influence on the
overall transportation
system.

TDAs – A Method to Protect
Idaho’s State Highway System

• Safely move traffic and
• Safely move traffic and

maintain adequate speeds
maintain adequate speeds

• Maintains the functionality of
• Maintains the functionality of

the system as it was designed
the system as it was
designed

• Limit and control access
• Limit and control access

• Acquire appropriate
• Acquire appropriate

setbacks and/or rights-of- way
setbacks and/or rights-of-
way

• Proactive instead of reactive
• Proactive instead of reactive

• Interagency Agreements: IC§67-2332
• Interagency Agreements: IC§67-2332

– Provides that public agencies may contract with

each other
each other

– Provides that local government agencies can

require conditions of approval
require conditions of approval

• Private Agreements: IC§67-8214

– Provides for private agreements between ITD and

developers to mitigate system improvements
developers to mitigate system improvements

TDA Opportunities
TDA Opportunities

• True Public-Private Partnership (3P)
• True Public-Private Partnership (3P)

• Formalized process to link and resolve
• Formalized process to link and resolve

state and local transportation and land use issues
state and local transportation and land
use issues

• Cost recovery for needed improvements (pay-as-you-go
• Cost recovery for needed improvements (pay-as-you-go

philosophy) – development pays for itself
philosophy) – development pays for itself

• Coordinated improvements are made as they are warranted
• Coordinated improvements are made as they are warranted

• Does not preclude the use of other funding mechanisms
• Does not preclude the use of other funding mechanisms

• Public is fully informed of future development activities as
• Public is fully informed of future development activities as

the are planned/developed
the are planned/developed

• Proportionate share instead of first one in pays for all
• Proportionate share instead of first one in pays for all

City/County “Responsibilities”
City/County “Responsibilities”

• Land Use Applications
• Land Use Applications

– City/County will provide ITD with copies of all
– City/County will provide ITD with copies of all

land use applications
land use applications

– ITD will review and make comments on the
– ITD will review and make comments on the

applications
applications

– City/County will permit ITD to sign final plats
– City/County will permit ITD to sign final plats

or hold final plats until all conditions have been met when development encroachment/access is granted or land is dedicated to the state
or hold final plats until all conditions have been met when
development encroachment/access is granted or land is
dedicated to the state

• Consideration of Comments
• Consideration of Comments

– City/County will consider comments and include, if agreed,
– City/County will consider comments and include, if agreed,

the comments into the conditions of approval
the comments into the conditions of approval

ITD “Responsibilities”
ITD “Responsibilities”

• Encroachment/Permit Applications
• Encroachment/Permit Applications

– ITD will provide City/County with copies of all encroachment/access permit applications
– ITD will provide City/County with copies of all
encroachment/access permit applications

– City/County will review and make comments on the
– City/County will review and make comments on the

encroachment/access permit application and upon approval, sign application
encroachment/access permit application
and upon approval, sign application

• Consideration of Comments
• Consideration of Comments

– ITD will consider comments prior to issuance of
– ITD will consider comments prior to issuance of

encroachment/access permit
encroachment/access permit

– City/County will not issue preliminary and/or final plats until encroachment/access permit has been granted by ITD
– City/County will not issue preliminary and/or final plats
until encroachment/access permit has been granted by
ITD

development approach is encouraged and supported – Long-term planning by City/County and ITD is
development approach is encouraged and
supported

recognized and mutually achieved
recognized and mutually achieved

– Improvements may be paid for by developers

– Citizens are a part of the process on both sides
– Citizens are a part of the process on both sides

• No additional staff and/or costs are needed
• No additional staff and/or costs are needed

to administer this Agreement
to administer this Agreement
